definition[0]: used as an answer to say that something is true or that you agree
example[1]: ‘It was a great show.’ ‘Yes, it was.’
definition[1]: used as an answer to a question or statement containing a negative, to say that the opposite is true
example[2]: ‘Sarah isn’t very intelligent, is she?’ ‘Yes, she is  (=in fact, she is intelligent)!’
example[3]: ‘There isn’t any cereal left.’ ‘Yes, there is – it’s in the cupboard.’
definition[2]: used as an answer to say that you want something or want to do something

definition[6]: used to show that you are very excited or happy about something
